pageContext.claim: “And, in China, the rates are whatever President Xi wants. He's his own Fed. He's the Federal Reserve. He's -- one man. He's the Federal Reserve. He's the President. He's everything else.”
pageContext.analysis: Experts say the Chinese central bank lacks independence from the ruling party and President Xi's government, which makes it easier for the Chinese to manipulate the value of their currency. But that's not the same as what Trump claims. He said Xi serves as the "head of the Fed." That's not the case.
